name: Ctrl Group
slogan: Building digital health products to bring personalised health care to everyone
description:
We’re building Fora Health – a platform that supports better conversations between patients and the people that care for them. We’re also building Cognition Kit – new interactive ways of measuring people’s cognitive health (think short games and tasks, a little bit like brain-training, but more scientific). And we have lots more exciting plans for 2019.

We’re changing the way health care works for everyone and making our products super usable and engaging. We’re making the most of technology to support patients and clinicians in their everyday life.

team.title: Project Manager
team.name: Ben Carrington
team.bioHtml: Science Nerd | Brand Director | Operations Manager | Healthtech Advocate

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
Join our team to help us build partnerships for Fora Health and Cognition Kit

Ctrl Group builds digital products for patients, healthcare practitioners and researchers to gather evidence and provide better care.

We’re looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team in London. It’s a really exciting time to join us – as our products become more widely used.

You will work directly with the company founders and our team of designers, researchers and engineers to tell the story of [Fora Health](https://fora.health/) and [Cognition Kit](https://www.cognitionkit.com/) and how they can be used to support clinical research and healthcare. You will keep our communications focused and relevant. You will manage the sales pipeline and generate sales. You will help manage relationships with partners, expert advisors and customers.

Right now we’re building Fora Health - a platform that supports better conversations between patients and the people that care for them. We’re also building Cognition Kit - new interactive ways of measuring people’s cognitive health. We have other exciting plans which we’d like to talk more about in person.

We’re changing the way health care works for everyone. We’re making the most of technology to support patients and clinicians in their everyday life. Your role as a project manager will help our small team deliver on our ambitious goals.

**We are looking for someone who:**
* Enjoys working in small teams with designers, software engineers, clinicians and scientists
* Believes in the role of technology to improve medical research and healthcare
* Is meticulous and organised
* Is capable of planning strategic initiatives, delivering projects and replanning when circumstances change
* Has a great understanding of business development tools and techniques
* Is a good communicator

**What we are offering:**
* Competitive salary
* Pension programme
* Flexible working arrangements
* Great workspace, 5 minutes walk from Old Street Underground

**Right to work:**
In order to apply for this job, you should have the right to work in the UK.

**Equality Statement:**
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

**How to apply:**
Please submit your details via [this form](https://airtable.com/shru8WDhyI4SCKLef?prefill_Role=Business+Development+Manager).

**No recruiters, please.**

jobs.title: User Researcher
jobs.description:
Join our team to bring the best practices of user research to the world of digital health.

Ctrl Group builds digital products for patients, healthcare practitioners and researchers to gather evidence and provide better care.

We’re looking for a user researcher to join our team in London. It’s a really exciting time to join us - we’re building our first products and taking them to market. So it’s a chance to really make your mark.

Right now we’re building [Fora Health](https://fora.health/) - a platform that supports better conversations between patients and the people that care for them. We’re also building [Cognition Kit](https://www.cognitionkit.com/) - new interactive ways of measuring people’s cognitive health. We have other exciting plans which we’d like to talk more about in person.

We’re changing the way health care works for everyone. We’re making the most of technology to support patients and clinicians in their everyday life. So we need our products to be super usable and engaging. Your role as a user researcher will help guide the way.

**We are looking for someone who:**
* Enjoys working in small teams with designers, software engineers, clinicians and scientists
* Believes in the role of technology to improve medical research and healthcare
* Develops research methodologies that generate deep insights and focus the team on what’s important to patients and clinicians
* Is capable of planning and delivering user research that combines usability analysis, semi-structured interviews and contextual research
* Is interested in and familiar with clinical research and quantitative methods - as our products are also evaluated within clinical trials
* Enjoys working directly with patients and clinicians in field research
* Communicates research insights in a way that inspires creative solutions to user needs

**What we are offering:**
* Competitive salary
* Pension programme
* Flexible working arrangements
* Great workspace, 5 minutes walk from Old Street Underground

**Right to work:**
In order to apply for this job, you should have the right to work in the UK.

**Equality Statement:**
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

**How to apply:**
Please submit your details via [this form](https://airtable.com/shru8WDhyI4SCKLef?prefill_Role=User+Researcher).

**No recruiters, please.**
